channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-2096] Install time for the cartridge takes too long.
item.description:
The Install time for the cartridge is too long, other cartridges on the system take 30 seconds to 2 minutes (under load) to install the cartridge.

https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-2018 and https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-1999 are caused because of the install time for the cartridge.
item.summary: Install time for the cartridge takes too long.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I think I identified the root cause of this issue while troubleshooting https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-2095. With https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-2095?focusedCommentId=13013063&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13013063 in place you can see that the loop checking if the console is up causes this long delay.

October 17 17:52:11 INFO Running install for 54418f7b7f116a704e0002ef/amq
October 17 17:57:23 INFO Shell command '/sbin/runuser -s /bin/sh 54418f7b7f116a704e0002ef -c "exec /usr/bin/runcon 'unconfined_u:system_r:openshift_t:s0:c3,c644' /bin/sh -c \"/var/lib/openshift/54418f7b7f116a704e0002ef/amq/bin/install --version 6.1.1\""' ran. rc=1 out=CLIENT_RESULT: Generating password
CLIENT_RESULT: Configuring zookeeper server
...
CLIENT_RESULT: 17:52:17
CLIENT_RESULT: TRACE: (300): curl -s http://admin:pmPDVS3SD8Aj@127.7.61.129:8080/jolokia/read/io.fabric8:type=Fabric/CurrentContainerName
CLIENT_RESULT:
...
CLIENT_RESULT: 17:52:44
CLIENT_RESULT: TRACE: (273): curl -s http://admin:pmPDVS3SD8Aj@127.7.61.129:8080/jolokia/read/io.fabric8:type=Fabric/CurrentContainerName
CLIENT_RESULT: <html>
...
CLIENT_RESULT: 17:54:29
CLIENT_RESULT: TRACE: (171): curl -s http://admin:pmPDVS3SD8Aj@127.7.61.129:8080/jolokia/read/io.fabric8:type=Fabric/CurrentContainerName
CLIENT_RESULT: {"error_type":"javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException","error":"javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException
...
CLIENT_RESULT: 17:57:22
CLIENT_RESULT: TRACE: (2): curl -s http://admin:pmPDVS3SD8Aj@127.7.61.129:8080/jolokia/read/io.fabric8:type=Fabric/CurrentContainerName
CLIENT_RESULT: {"error_type":"javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException","error":"javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException
CLIENT_ERROR: Command Failed: Could not reach myamq console.
CLIENT_ERROR: {"error_type":"javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException","error":"javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException

October 17 17:57:23 INFO Shell command 'quota --always-resolve -w 54418f7b7f116a704e0002ef' ran. rc=0 out=Disk quotas for user 54418f7b7f116a704e0002ef (uid 3707):
Filesystem blocks quota limit grace files quota limit grace
/dev/vda1 95776 0 5242880 2029 0 80000

It looks like for every 100 times you attempt this look up you wait 2 minutes.
If this can be reproduced, we should look at it for 6.2.

A few possible improvements:

  • avoid going to http, i.e. make sure all artifacts are present in system/
    both at boot time and when fabric is created
  • cache org.apache.karaf.service.guard.impl.GuardProxyCatalog#getServiceInvocationRoles
  • avoid the installation of OBR bundle
  • avoid deploying servicemix specs that are actually provided by the system bundle
    to minimize the bundle scanning (each spec scans all bundles for META-INF/services/* files)

In addition to making sure all the artifacts are available in the system folder, I've raised the following issues:

  • https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FELIX-4810
  • https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FELIX-4811
  • https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXLOGGING-190
  • https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KARAF-3576
  • https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FELIX-4812
  • https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KARAF-3577
  • https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXURL-309

The above fixes cause the load time for jboss-fuse-full to drop from 45s to 16s on my laptop.

Other possible improvements:

  • avoid deploying servicemix specs that are actually provided by the system bundle to minimize the bundle scanning (each spec scans all bundles for META-INF/services/* files)
